intro: Gentiana nyingchiensis, commonly known as the Nyingchi gentian, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Tibet. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude meadows and rocky habitats, thriving in cool and moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with a fine layer of hair, while its stems are usually unbranched. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its harsh alpine habitat.
